conditions.harmful: High humidity associated with cloudy weather, which results in the spread of fungal diseases like damping off and powdery mildew.
conditions.beneficial: Light rains followed by bright sunshine.

Soil requirements.type: Medium soil type ranging from sandy clayey loam.
properties: Well-drained as water logging is extremely harmful.

Land preparation.general: Similar to any Rabi crop, but the soil should not be very pulverised and fine.
Land preparation.requirements: Must be free from all established weeds and stubbles of the previous kharif crop.
Land preparation.rainfed_conditions_treatment: Treat with 20-25 kg of 5% BHC or heptachlor dust to prevent termite attacks.
Land preparation.levelling: The bed should be thoroughly levelled, especially for irrigated conditions, for proper water distribution.

recommendations.organic_manure: 15-20 tonnes of well-decomposed organic manure (compost or F.Y.M.) for very light soils.

Fertilizer management.application: The entire quantity of manures and fertilizers should be basal placed about 10-15 cm deep in furrows (3 to 5 cm below the seed layer).

Water management.sowing: Soil should have sufficient moisture at the time of sowing for good germination.

irrigation.schedule: Two light irrigations are needed after germination.
irrigation.timing: First at 45-50 days and second at 75 days after sowing, or first at flowering and second at pod filling stage.

Weed control.manual: Two hand weedings at 20 and 45 days after sowing.

chemical.name: Tribunil
chemical.application: Pre-emergence spray, can substitute for Basalin and controls all weeds.

control_measures: Avoid early sowing to avoid high humidity and high temperature.
Use treated seed with Ceresan or Captan (2 to 2.5 g/kg seed).
Select powdery mildew resistant varieties, like Rachana, Hans, etc.
Avoid late sowing of the crop.
Spray with a wettable sulphur compound (e.g., Sulfex, Elosal, Hexasual) at 0.3% solution. Two or three sprayings are needed.
Dusting with sulphur if spraying is not possible.

Shoot fly and caterpillars.control: Spray with 0.05% Thiodan at fortnightly intervals. Two to three sprayings are sufficient.

Aphids.control: Spray with 0.4% Menazon or 0.25% Dimecron at 8-10 day intervals.
